title: 114_hr2151
content: The Act is titled the "Improving Oversight and Accountability in Medicaid Non-DSH Supplemental Payments Act." It aims to enhance the calculation, oversight, and accountability of non-DSH supplemental payments under the Medicaid program. The Act "Improving Oversight and Accountability in Medicaid Non-DSH Supplemental Payments Act" amends Section 1903 of the Social Security Act to provide guidance to States on permissible methods for calculating non-DSH supplemental payments to providers. It also establishes annual reporting requirements for States making such payments. The Act provides guidance on calculating non-DSH supplemental payments to providers, including reporting requirements for States. This includes identifying providers, their ownership, and the amount of payments received. The Secretary determines necessary information for non-DSH supplemental payments to providers, including requirements for States to conduct annual audits verifying consistency with guidance and payments for covered services to eligible individuals. Non-DSH supplemental payments are additional payments made by a State to a provider for services furnished to individuals eligible for medical assistance. The text discusses non-DSH supplemental payments made by states to providers for services provided to eligible individuals. It also mentions the requirements for states to report and audit these payments. The paragraph discusses the conditions for states to make non-DSH supplemental payments and the reporting and auditing requirements that must be met.
